items.title: Why High Performers Can’t Rest—and How to Fix It
items.author: That Career Coach - Kendall Berg
items.content:
Why do high performers feel guilty taking a break? Discover the secret to guilt-free rest and career success.
Are you stuck in the toxic cycle of tying your self-worth to your job title? In this episode, Kendall Berg reveals the surprising truth about why high achievers struggle to disconnect and how this impacts their mental health, productivity, and career growth. Backed by Harvard research, this video dives into actionable strategies to set boundaries, redefine success, and embrace rest as a power move for 2025.

✅ Topics Covered:

Why rest feels impossible for high performers
The shocking truth about back-to-back meetings
Strategies to recharge without guilt
How hobbies fuel success and happiness

00:00 Intro: Why Disconnecting Feels Impossible
02:08 The Stress High Performers Hide
05:38 Harvard’s Surprising Productivity Hack
08:00 How to Set Boundaries for PTO
11:18 Is Your Job Title Controlling You?
14:55 Finding Your Identity Outside of Work
17:38 Why You Need a Hobby in 2025
21:06 Rest vs. Laziness: The Real Difference
23:15 Closing Thoughts: Balance in 2025

items.title: Why Rest is the Secret to Career Success in 2025
items.author: That Career Coach - Kendall Berg
items.content:
💡 Your hustle isn’t the problem—it’s the trap of tying your identity to your job title. Harvard research reveals the truth about burnout, and I’ve got the strategies to recharge guilt-free. Stream 𝑺𝒆𝒄𝒓𝒆𝒕𝒔 𝒐𝒇 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝑪𝒂𝒓𝒆𝒆𝒓 𝑮𝒂𝒎𝒆 now.

𝑾𝒉𝒂𝒕’𝒔 𝒚𝒐𝒖𝒓 𝒈𝒐-𝒕𝒐 𝒘𝒂𝒚 𝒕𝒐 𝒓𝒆𝒄𝒉𝒂𝒓𝒈𝒆? 𝑳𝒆𝒕 𝒎𝒆 𝒌𝒏𝒐𝒘 𝒊𝒏 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒄𝒐𝒎𝒎𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔!

Investing in your team is critical, but how do you ensure a real ROI? @apmpofficial 📈 Not only can leadership development help your team grow, but it also drives company innovation and success. 🌟 APMP proves it—studies show that for every $1 invested in their education and resources, companies see $6,224 in business returns. 🚀 Build a stronger, well-rounded leadership team with APMP!

#Leadership #training #ad #paidpartner #APMP #proudtobeAPMP

items.title: It is time to stop applying and start connecting.
items.author: That Career Coach - Kendall Berg
items.content:
Are you cold applying (or worse—just LinkedIn easy applying) for jobs with little to no success? Build and leverage your network! By getting to know the hiring parties of your target companies, you can increase your chances of being hired and getting the job you want!

#jobmarket #recruiting #networking #career

items.title: Why Personal Branding is the Key to Standing Out
items.author: That Career Coach - Kendall Berg
items.content:
Personal Branding will help you provide clarity in your career—both to your peers/leaders and to yourself. Aligning your skills and interests with your brand and career progression is the recipe for success.

How has your personal branding given you an edge in your career? Share your experience in the comments!

#careercoach #personalbrand #workfromhome

items.title: Building Self-Confidence: How Danette Haag Turned Adversity Into Career Success
items.author: That Career Coach - Kendall Berg
items.content:
Pain is pain, and scars—whether seen or unseen—affect us all.  In the latest episode of 𝑺𝒆𝒄𝒓𝒆𝒕𝒔 𝒐𝒇 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝑪𝒂𝒓𝒆𝒆𝒓 𝑮𝒂𝒎𝒆, Danette Haag opens up about her journey from surviving a devastating gas explosion to reframing her scars as symbols of strength. Through resilience, gratitude, and belief in herself, Danette not only overcame her challenges but also built a successful career and was crowned Mrs. Colorado. 👑

She shares actionable tools for building self-confidence and turning setbacks into stepping stones for both career and life success.

Listen now for insights that could redefine how you view challenges in your career and life.

🎧 Stream the full episode of 𝑺𝒆𝒄𝒓𝒆𝒕𝒔 𝒐𝒇 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝑪𝒂𝒓𝒆𝒆𝒓 𝑮𝒂𝒎𝒆 to learn how to embrace your journey

💬 𝐇𝐨𝐰 𝐡𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐧𝐞𝐝 𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐧𝐠𝐞𝐬 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐠𝐫𝐨𝐰𝐭𝐡 𝐨𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐞𝐬? 𝐋𝐞𝐭’𝐬 𝐝𝐢𝐬𝐜𝐮𝐬𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬! 

#CareerResilience #SelfConfidence #PersonalGrowth #SecretsOfTheCareerGame

items.title: How to Build Confidence After Trauma | Danette Haag's Survival Success Story
items.author: That Career Coach - Kendall Berg
items.content:
Discover how Danette Haag overcame trauma to build unstoppable self-confidence and inspire career growth.
⭐️ Get our FREE Accomplishments Tracker:
https://fabulous-butterfly-83716.myflodesk.com/n8yzvrtw9v 

#selfconfidence   #CareerGrowth #Resilience #TraumaToTriumph #CareerConfidence #MindsetMastery

Danette Haag survived a devastating gas explosion at just 10 years old and transformed her scars into a narrative of resilience, beauty, and self-acceptance. In this episode, she shares how redefining her mindset helped her build confidence and create new opportunities in her life and career.

In this episode, you’ll learn:
How to shift your mindset to overcome self-doubt.
Gratitude as a game-changer for personal growth.
Journaling techniques to process emotions and stay motivated.

🚀 Build out the tools you need to navigate the corporate game: https://thatcareercoach.mykajabi.com/offers/ozjqcWM9/checkout

items.title: Share Your Workplace Horror Stories from 2024
items.author: That Career Coach - Kendall Berg
items.content:
Did you catch feelings for a coworker, witness office drama straight out of a soap opera, or get swept up in a whirlwind of workplace gossip?

Maybe it was something so shocking or downright bizarre that it felt straight out of a horror movie—or so hilarious it’s still the talk of the break room (or better left anonymous)?

We’re collecting the most jaw-dropping, laugh-out-loud, or cringe-worthy workplace stories of 2024. Whether it’s about love, drama, or pure chaos, we want to hear it—all anonymously, of course.

items.title: Communication and Soft skills are more Important than Technical Skills
items.author: That Career Coach - Kendall Berg
items.content:

What is your go-to tip for clear and impactful communication? Share it in the comments!
